what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal ggethos provide user-frienldy way plot ethograms using ggplot2.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: point, experimental package, can install development version GitHub : ’s CRAN, can install released version ggethos CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example plotting ethograms ggethos: Let’s plot behavior wombats  Let’s look using proper x axis separating trials:  Can align trials? Yes! Use align_trials = TRUE:
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggethos) library(dplyr) wombats %>%    group_by(wombat) %>%    slice(1:2) #> # A tibble: 8 × 9 #> # Groups:   wombat [4] #>   wombat trial behaviour trial_frame frame seconds exp_dt              #>   <chr>  <int> <chr>           <int> <int>   <dbl> <dttm>              #> 1 gimli      1 <NA>                1     1       0 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #> 2 gimli      1 <NA>                2     2       5 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #> 3 jerry      1 <NA>                1     1       0 2020-09-21 22:16:33 #> 4 jerry      1 <NA>                2     2       5 2020-09-21 22:16:33 #> 5 pomelo     1 digging             1     1       0 2019-09-20 23:57:04 #> 6 pomelo     1 digging             2     2       5 2019-09-20 23:57:04 #> 7 speedy     1 pondering           1     1       0 2020-01-14 08:37:44 #> 8 speedy     1 pondering           2     2       5 2020-01-14 08:37:44 #> # … with 2 more variables: start_dt <dttm>, end_dt <dttm> # x axis will be in sample space ggplot(wombats, aes(y=wombat, behaviour=behaviour)) + geom_ethogram() # x axis will be in seconds ggplot(wombats, aes(x=seconds,                      y=wombat,                      behaviour=behaviour,                     color=behaviour)) +    geom_ethogram() +   facet_wrap(~trial) # x axis will be in seconds # trials re-aligned ggplot(wombats, aes(x=seconds,                      y=wombat,                      behaviour=behaviour,                     color=behaviour)) +    geom_ethogram(align_trials = T) +   facet_wrap(~trial)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: preliminary release package still much experimental. Please file issues improve .

title: Ethogram Geom Wrapper — geom_ethogram
code: geom_ethogram(mapping = NULL, data = NULL, stat = "etho",   position = "identity", ..., size = 5, arrow = NULL,   lineend = "butt", linejoin = "round", na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA, inherit.aes = TRUE, align_trials = FALSE,   remove_nas = TRUE)

title: Ethogram Geom Wrapper — geom_ethogram
text: mapping Set aesthetics created `aes()` `aes_()`. specified `inherit.aes = TRUE` (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply `mapping` plot mapping. data Data provided plot provided previous `ggplot(data, ...)` layer align_trials boolean indicating whether align trials zero (default = FALSE) remove_nas boolean indicating whether remove `NAs` data (default = TRUE)

title: Wombats datasets — wombats
text: datasets contain toy data experiment way `ggethos` expects data given

title: Wombats datasets — wombats
code: wombats #> # A tibble: 823 × 9 #>    wombat trial behaviour trial_frame frame seconds exp_dt              #>    <chr>  <int> <chr>           <int> <int>   <dbl> <dttm>              #>  1 gimli      1 NA                  1     1       0 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #>  2 gimli      1 NA                  2     2       5 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #>  3 gimli      1 NA                  3     3      10 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #>  4 gimli      1 NA                  4     4      15 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #>  5 gimli      1 NA                  5     5      20 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #>  6 gimli      1 digging             6     6      25 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #>  7 gimli      1 digging             7     7      30 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #>  8 gimli      1 digging             8     8      35 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #>  9 gimli      1 digging             9     9      40 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #> 10 gimli      1 digging            10    10      45 2019-08-28 06:37:44 #> # … with 813 more rows, and 2 more variables: start_dt <dttm>, end_dt <dttm> wombats_duration #> # A tibble: 74 × 10 #>    wombat trial behaviour start_se…¹ end_s…² exp_dt              trial…³ trial…⁴ #>    <chr>  <int> <fct>          <dbl>   <dbl> <dttm>                <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1 gimli      1 digging            5      13 2019-08-28 06:37:44       0     200 #>  2 gimli      1 pondering         20      33 2019-08-28 06:37:44       0     200 #>  3 gimli      1 digging           33      41 2019-08-28 06:37:44       0     200 #>  4 gimli      2 snuffling        215     477 2019-08-28 06:37:44     205     465 #>  5 gimli      2 digging          217     500 2019-08-28 06:37:44     205     465 #>  6 gimli      2 digging          253     518 2019-08-28 06:37:44     205     465 #>  7 gimli      3 pondering        481     669 2019-08-28 06:37:44     470     650 #>  8 gimli      3 pondering        497     687 2019-08-28 06:37:44     470     650 #>  9 gimli      4 digging          655    1024 2019-08-28 06:37:44     655    1020 #> 10 gimli      4 pondering        659    1034 2019-08-28 06:37:44     655    1020 #> #
